item.title: Breadth-first Search
item.description: Breadth-first Search Algorithm The Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithm is used to traverse or search a graph or tree data structure. It explores all the nodes at the current depth level before moving on to the nodes at the next depth level. BFS is often used to find the shortest path between two nodes in an unweighted graph. import ast def convert_input_to_grid(input_string): # Use ast.literal_eval to safely evaluate the string into a list of lists grid = ast.
